column7: NOTE: readings for item names, originally printed alongside the kanji versions in the messages above. obviously not needed for the translation, but they ARE still printed, so leave these blank.

NOTE: technique name readings. i think it would be best to keep the technique names transliterated but provide their meanings in the descriptions, so i've repurposed these for that. can be removed with no consequences if desired.

some of these are actual words, others are just kanji rammed together to suggest a meaning. for consistency, and the benefit of anyone who might be trying to learn to associate the meanings with the syllables, i'm listing the meanings of the individual kanji for all of them, with the meaning of the word they form (if any) after that.
